title: Day Is Longer Than Night
text:
Day Is Longer Than Night () is a 1984 Georgian <a href="drama%20film">drama film</a> directed by <a href="Lana%20Gogoberidze">Lana Gogoberidze</a>. It was entered into the <a href="1984%20Cannes%20Film%20Festival">1984 Cannes Film Festival</a>.
Plot.
The film tells the story of a woman's difficult fate. For eighty years Eva spent her life in a <a href="Georgia%20%28country%29">Georgian</a> <a href="Aul">mountain village</a>. There she married Georgiy the shepherd, who soon died, possibly murdered. After this she married Spyridon out of compassion for his lonesome, gloomy lost soul. In her native village Eva lived through the <a href="Russian%20Revolution">revolution</a> and <a href="Russian%20civil%20war">civil war</a>, the <a href="New%20Economic%20Policy">NEP</a> and the <a href="Collectivization%20in%20the%20Soviet%20Union">collectivization</a>.
And now Eva lives in a deserted village. Most of the villagers move to the city where living is simpler and easier and life is always seething. And even the mother of Eva's beloved grandson who has come from the city, wants to take him away with her. But the boy remains with his grandmother who believes that the village where their ancestors lived will be reborn.
